sub_title: Scientist in Structural Health Monitoring, Technical Lead Offshore Renewable Energies at TNO
summary: Highly motivated engineer, strong team player, always eager to learn, and keen on solving challenging problems with the highest quality. Experienced in executing multidisciplinary projects combining hardware and sensor systems with software applications. Has broad knowledge in monitoring systems, data analysis, physics, materials, structures and modelling.

projects.title: Realisation and Demonstration of Advanced Material Solutions for Sustainable and Efficient Ships (RAMSSES)
projects.description:
VIDEO: https://vimeo.com/522716506
Impact tests on RAMSSES demonstrator at Damen in Vlissingen prove resilience of composites to harsh marine environment. Multiple impact tests surpassing helicopter emergency landing loads are demonstrated on the RAMSSES hull shell and its composite helicopter deck.

Within the RAMSSES project, led by Damen Schelde Naval Shipbuilding and Damen Shipyards Gorinchem in cooperation with InfraCore Company, Evonik, Airborne UK and TNO, a 6m high hull section made out of composite material has been developed scaling up the composite technology and capability to design, produce and market complete composite vessels up to 85 m length that comply with SOLAS and class regulations.

projects.title: AIRTuB
projects.description:
The AIRTuB objectives are:
• Develop a fully tested prototype of an autonomous UAV equipped with a sensing system capable of detecting structural damage and leading-edge erosion.
• Develop models for leading-edge erosion yield impact for asset management and operational decisions.
• Develop technology for automated application of sheet coatings.
• Design software for automatically classifying leading-edge erosion and generating automatic repair 'recipes'.

profile_positions.description:
•	Designing and demonstrating acoustic-ultrasonic monitoring systems for: a) Steel bridges; b) Wind turbine support structures; Wind turbine blades; c) Composite ship structures; d) Composite geothermal pipelines.
•	Fusing different acoustic-ultrasonic systems for improving damage diagnosis.
•	Developing machine learning tools for pattern and anomaly detection, and damage classification.
•	Integrating optical systems and numerical models for improved structural fatigue prediction.
•	Combining multiple measurement systems and models for improved fatigue assessment.
•	Coordinating the deployment of different sensor systems for the demonstration of a field lab.
•	Providing technical advice for new projects in the Offshore Renewable Energy domain.
•	Managing consultancy operations for industrial clients.
•	Providing expert consultancy for industrial clients.
•	Contribute to writing of new project proposals.
•	Managing the regular contact with academic and industrial partners.
profile_positions.title: Scientist in Structure Monitoring | Technical Lead Offshore Renewable Energies

profile_positions.description:
•	Developed capabilities for simultaneous ultrasonic and fatigue testing.
•	Investigated signal processing algorithms for reliable damage detection in composites.
•	Managed a team responsible for the integration of hardware systems and software.
•	Technical contact with industrial partners for the AIRTuB project: Developing a drone-based autonomous system for wind turbine blade inspection.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Fellow in Structural Health Monitoring

profile_positions.description:
Research focused on ultrasonic guided wave based health monitoring of thermoplastic composite aircraft structures using piezoelectric transducers. The final goal was to improve the reliability of damage diagnostic and bring the technology closer to certification.

•	Established an approach for diagnosing manufacturing defects in ultrasonically welded joints.
•	Developed and validated a methodology for designing a structural health monitoring system.
•	Developed capabilities for model-assisted reliability analysis of health monitoring systems.
•	Demonstrated the health monitoring capabilities on real-scale composite aircraft structures.
•	Discovered effects of structural vibration on guided wave signals.

Research funded by the Netherlands Enterprise Agency of the Ministry of Economic Affairs, as part of the TAPAS 2 project, in close collaboration with Fokker Aerostructures B.V., NLR-Netherlands Aerospace Centre, and Airbus.
Gained experience in supervising students at MSc thesis level and in lecturing workshops at the level of university of applied sciences.
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher in Structural Health Monitoring

profile_positions.description:
Fatigue and damage tolerance analysis and redesign of high-lift device structures for Airbus aircraft.

•	Performed stress, fatigue and damage tolerance calculations for several metallic movable structures for the A320/321, A330/340 and A380 programmes.
•	Developed tools to automate calculations.
•	Wrote and verified justification reports for the analysed structures.
•	Provided direct support to the client on the resolution of time-sensitive issues.
>>>>> Secondment in Airbus Operations (Bremen, Germany), Oct. 2013 - Dec. 2013.
profile_positions.title: Structural Engineer

profile_positions.description:
•	Studied temperature effects on static and fatigue behaviour of composites.
•	Built an adaptive climate chamber for mechanical tests with special environmental conditions.
•	Performed static and fatigue tests up to failure for multiple industrial projects.
•	Instrumented test coupons according to recommended practices.
profile_positions.title: Materials Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Multiple low-energy impact damage diagnostic in composite plates using ultrasonic guided waves.
•	Engineered, installed and operated a monitoring system based on piezoelectric transducers.
•	Obtained a valid diagnostic of the induced damages.
•	Validated the results with digital shearography, ultrasonic C-scan and optical microscope.
•	Completed MSc Thesis (grade 19/20).
profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher
